chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.
items.plainText: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.

items.text: When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
items.plainText: When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.

items.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
items.plainText: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

items.text: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
items.plainText: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.

items.text: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
items.plainText: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

items.text: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.
items.plainText: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.

items.text: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
items.plainText: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.

items.text: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
items.plainText: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.

items.text: An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
items.plainText: An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.

items.text: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
items.plainText: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.

items.text: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
items.plainText: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

items.text: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
items.plainText: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.

items.text: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
items.plainText: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.

items.text: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
items.plainText: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

items.text: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
items.plainText: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.

items.text: A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.
items.plainText: A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.

items.text: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
items.plainText: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.

items.text: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
items.plainText: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.

items.text: As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
items.plainText: As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.

items.text: They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.
items.plainText: They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.

items.text: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
items.plainText: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.

items.text: As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
items.plainText: As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.

items.text: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
items.plainText: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

items.text: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.
items.plainText: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.

items.text: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
items.plainText: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.

items.text: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
items.plainText: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

items.text: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
items.plainText: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.

items.text: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
items.plainText: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.

items.text: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
items.plainText: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

items.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
items.plainText: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.

items.text: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
items.plainText: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
